The Red Panda

The Red Panda is a cat-size mammal originally from southwestern China. It has reddish-brown fur and a long, bushy tail. Red pandas primarily eat bamboo, but are considered carnivorous as they also eat eggs, birds, and insects.

executableContent.instructions:
Complete the button styling by adding appropriate class names to both the style.css file and the HTML button elements. 

1. Add the classes `login` and `signup` to the HTML `button` elements.
2. Next, add the classes `login` and `signup` to the stylesheet. The login button should have a `blueviolet` background color with `white` text, and the sign up button should be the other way around.

<!doctype html>
<html>
  <head>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
  </head>
  <body>
    <button>Log In</button>
    <button>Sign Up</button>
  </body>
</html>
files.solvedContent:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <head>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
  </head>
  <body>
    <button class="login">Log In</button>
    <button class="signup">Sign Up</button>
  </body>
</html>

executableContent.instructions:
Now, a "Book Trip" button has been added to the bottom of the page. Complete the tasks to style its appearance. 

1. First, target the `button` element and set its `border` properties to `1px` wide, a `solid` border, and the color `gray`. Do this in a single line.
2. Next, set the `border-radius` property to `10px`.
3. Next, set the `background-color` property to `lightblue`.
4. Finally, make the button as wide as the `body` element. 

Ensure all CSS values are written in lowercase.
